event: Start of Muslim holy month of Ramadan
introduction: Terrorism threats and propaganda can be elevated in some regions during Ramadan. In addition, protests have occurred in Muslim-majority countries during Ramadan and the celebration of Eid al-Fitr (marking the end of Ramadan). Ramadan could also trigger anti-Muslim hate crimes or sentiment in some non-Muslim majority countries. The Middle East conflicts will likely drive increased threats during Ramadan in 2025.
Annual meetings of the government’s top advisory body, the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference and the National Peoples’ Congress will occur, outlining China’s economic policies.

The elections to the 31-seat legislature will take place amid heightened scrutiny given US President Donald Trump’s interest in the territory. While the next government is likely to be pro-independence from Denmark, no immediate change to Greenland’s status is likely.
The day commemorates the 1985 killings of two brothers by the police. Violent protests in Santiago and other cities traditionally occur on the day.

Threats against Jewish communities, people and assets are likely to be elevated in some countries during the Passover religious holiday. Islamist extremist groups have planned or conducted attacks targeting Passover celebrations in Israel. The Israel-Hamas conflict is likely to increase the intent of Islamist and right-wing extremists to target Jewish communities and religious assets during Passover.

event: World Bank and International Monetary Fund Spring Meetings
introduction: Stakeholders and decision-makers will discuss critical issues including the inflation outlook, growth trends and wider geopolitical developments.

May Day is typically celebrated by socialist and communist political movements and is a global day of action for anti-capitalist, anarchist and other left-wing activists. May Day protests in parts of Europe and North America involve vandalism, property damage and clashes with law enforcement and right-wing counter-demonstrators.

Romania in December 2024 annulled the presidential result citing Russian election interference. The rescheduled election is unlikely to fundamentally change the political landscape, which benefits far-right candidate Calin Georgescu. Georgescu is likely to win the election in a run-off on 18 May against opposition centrist Save Romania Union candidate Elena Lasconi.

All 318 seats in the House of Representatives (lower house) and 12 of the 24 seats in the Senate (upper house) will be contested. Local elections will also be held for the executive and legislative branches.

Palestinians commemorate Nakba (“catastrophe”) – a term they use to refer to when more than 700,000 Arabs fled or were expelled during the creation of Israel. The Middle East conflicts will drive higher turnouts at related protests globally.

ncumbent Andrzej Duda is ineligible for re-election. The election is likely to go to a second-round run-off on 1 June, and Warsaw mayor Rafal Trzaskowski, the candidate for the governing coalition, is the likely winner. Trzaskowski’s election would enable the coalition to pursue its agenda, while a victory by the opposition candidate would disrupt its agenda significantly.
Stakeholders in defence, security and geopolitics will discuss critical Indo-Pacific security challenges in Singapore.

event: Deadline for a Global Pandemic Treaty
introduction: WHO member states have extended the mandate of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Body, established in December 2021, to finish its work to negotiate a Global Pandemic Treaty.
Canada will host the G7 Leaders Summit in Kananaskis (Alberta).
The Netherlands for the first time will host the NATO Summit. It will take place in The Hague.
Sofia is expected to adopt the euro and become the 21st eurozone member. In July 2024, the Bulgarian parliament passed the relevant bill on its first reading.

Voters will elect the President, Vice President, and members of the legislative chambers. The elections are shaped by significant internal divisions within the ruling Movement for Socialism (MAS) party, as current President Luis Arce and former president Evo Morales, who has been barred from running, vie for influence.

event: First crewed mission to the Moon since 1972
introduction: Artemis II, the first crewed mission to the Moon since 1972 and second mission of the Artemis Program, is scheduled to launch no earlier than September 2025.
Norway’s polls will decide the composition of the 169-seat parliament (Storting) and indicate who might become the next prime minister.
The event will bring together global leaders, stakeholders, policymakers and experts to discuss a plethora of critical issues.
Brazil will host the conference in to the hope of making significant progress in climate agreements after the disappointment of COP29.

event: World Bank and International Monetary Fund (IMF) Annual Meeting
introduction: Experts, politicians and financial stakeholders will gather in Washington DC (US) to discuss critically relevant issues to the global economy.
South Africa will host global leaders of the G20 in Johannesburg.
